required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasonographic Assessment of Stomach in Two Different Fasting Guidelines
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasonographic Assessment of Stomach for Comparison of Antral Cross-sectional Area in Two Different Fasting Guidelines

brief_summary.textblock: Oral carbohydrate loading until 2 h before surgery is well known to be effective in facilitating postoperative recovery and reducing complications, by maintaining homeostasis. However, there are still concerns in implementing this as a universal fasting guideline, because of the risk of pulmonary aspiration. Therefore, we designed this study to compare the two preoperative fasting guideline: (1) keep fasted from midnight until surgery, and (2) oral carbohydrate beverage 800 mL from midnight until 2 h before surgery.

primary_outcome.description: Cross-sectional area of gastric antrum assessed by ultrasonography

secondary_outcome.description: Hunger score is scored from 0 (never) to 10 (very much).
Thirst score is scored from 0 (never) to 10 (very much).
Preoperative anxiety is scored from 0 (never) to 10 (very much).

arm_group.description: kept fasted from midnight until surgery
drink carbohydrate beverage until 2 h before surgery

intervention.description: Carbohydrate beverage (12.8% carbohydrates, 50 kcal/100 mL, 290 mOsm/kg) 800 mL is given to the NO-NPO group until 2 hours before surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult aged from 18 to 70
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) class I or II
- absence of pregnancy
- not on lactation at the time of surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- delayed gastric emptying (GERD, gastrointestinal disease, diabetes)
- contraindicated to NSAID or opioid
- mental disorders
- alcoholism
- drug abuse

eligibility.gender_description: Women with indication for laparoscopic gynecologic surgery for benign or premalignant gynecologic conditions
